entry.title: Re: FM to upload and read attachments in DMS
entry.content:
To upload and read documents in SAP DMS, you should use the standard DMS APIs instead of GOS.

For creating/uploading documents:

  • BAPI_DOCUMENT_CREATE2
    This is the recommended BAPI to create a DIR and upload originals.

  • Ensure KPro is correctly configured and the content repository is assigned.

  • Required RFC destinations:

    • SAPFTPA (FTP)

    • SAPHTTPA (HTTP)
      (Maintain them in SM59)

  • Files must be available on the application server (AL11), not a local PC for background processing.

For reading/displaying documents:

  • Use DMS APIs like:

    • CVAPI_DOC_GETDETAIL

    • CVAPI_DOC_CHECKOUTVIEW

    • CVAPI_DOC_FILE_READ

References:

  • SAP Note 504692

  • DMS API documentation on SAP Help

If the requirement is to attach documents to business objects (similar to GOS) but avoid SOFFCONT1, then DMS + KPro is the correct approach. Pure GOS attachments cannot be redirected to DMS without custom development.

entry.title: Re: How to create Dynamic dimension with Images stored in...
entry.content: In SAC, images cannot be consumed directly from SAP tables like SOFFCONT1 or from a Content Server via CDS as binary/BLOB fields. SAC dynamic images require a URL-based approach. The recommended solution is to expose the Business Partner logo via an HTTP-accessible endpoint (for example using ICF service, OData service, or SAP Content Server URL). In S/4HANA, you can create a CDS view that returns the Business Partner ID and the image URL (not the image itself). This CDS/OData service can then be consumed in SAC and used with the Dynamic Image feature by binding the image widget to the URL field. If logos are stored as GOS attachments, they must first be published to a content server or HTTP service; direct CDS consumption of SOFFCONT1 binary content is not supported in SAC.

entry.title: Re: SolMan HANA sizing
entry.content: Hi Arne, I’m also interested in how SolMan Service Desk attachments (SOFFCONT1 / CRMORDERCONT) are handled on HANA. Especially whether they are memory-resident or treated as LOBs and largely kept on disk / content server. If anyone has SAP notes or sizing experience, please share.

entry.title: Re: Redirecting documents to seperate Content Server
entry.content:
When you are providing a solution, workaround, explanation, or clear technical guidance that helps solve the question (even if it’s partial).
Example: explaining configuration steps, SAP Notes, tables, transactions, or confirming the root cause.

entry.title: Re: And an equally special thanks to aRS over in ABAP general
entry.content: Thanks for sharing this valuable insight. The explanation around SRGBTBREL and the relationship to SOFFCONT1 is extremely helpful, especially the GUID offset detail, which is often overlooked. This will definitely save time for anyone troubleshooting SAP Office and attachment relationships.

entry.title: Re: TABLE SPLITTING WITH SAPINST
entry.content:
Table splitting is fully supported by sapinst and Migration Monitor.

WHR files must be available before export starts and must be placed in the same export directory (…/ABAP/DATA) so that the same split definition is used during export and import.

You should use the same export directory for both phases. Sapinst will automatically recognize the split tables and generate multiple task (.TSK) files (create table, multiple load tasks, index creation).

Migration Monitor is started automatically by sapinst (NW 7.0 SR3+), so no manual start is required.

REPOLOAD does not need splitting (platform-specific), while SOFFCONT1 size should ideally be reduced beforehand using SAP Note 1634908.

entry.title: Re: Archiving Issue with these tables????
entry.content: Thanks for the references. These SAPoffice tables (SOFFCONT1, SOC3, SOOD, etc.) are not archived via standard Archiving Objects. Cleanup is done via reorganization reports like RSSO_DELETE_PRIVATE / RSSORE00 and RSBCS_REORG as mentioned in the OSS notes.

entry.title: Re: CRM - RSSORE00
entry.content: RSSORE00 is an SAPoffice reorganization report used to delete obsolete SAPoffice objects such as sent emails, attachments, and temporary documents that are stored in tables like SOFFCONT1, SOOD, SOOS, etc. The table SOFFCONT1 stores the actual content (attachments) of SAPoffice documents and GOS attachments, which is why it often grows very large. SAP uses this table whenever attachments are created via SAPoffice, workflow, or GOS. There is no classic archiving object for SOFFCONT1; instead, cleanup is done via reorganization reports such as RSSORE00 / RSSO_DELETE_PRIVATE and related SAP Notes (for example, SAP Note 904711 explains where SAPoffice documents are physically stored). Regular housekeeping or moving attachments to an external content server is recommended to control database growth.

entry.title: Re: How to create storage area in cv01n
entry.content: Thanks Juan. This clarifies that CV01N originals are stored in SAP Office tables (SOFFCONT1) by default and that configuring SAP Content Server / ArchiveLink is required to store them externally.

entry.title: Re: Email Archiving for ERMS and Interaction Center in SAP CRM
entry.content:
ERMS work items are archived via standard workflow archiving using object WORKITEM in transaction SWW_SARA.
If no records are shown, please check that the ERMS workflows are completed and not in error status, and verify workflow runtime tables (SWWWIHEAD).
Also ensure KBA 2197465 prerequisites are fully implemented, as ERMS work items are only eligible for archiving after proper completion and deletion settings.

entry.title: Re: Migration Error - SQL1505 -Create unique index aborted on duplicate key
entry.content: Thanks for sharing this discussion. Issues around SOFFCONT1 growth, archiving, and migration (especially with ERMS / SAPoffice data) are still very relevant. Using KPRO with an external content server and following the recommended SAP Notes (e.g. 904711, 1634908, 2197465) seems to be the most sustainable approach to control database size and avoid migration issues. This thread is very helpful for anyone facing similar challenges.

entry.title: Re: TREX - Generic Object Services (GOS) - CV04N -Content Server
entry.content: Thanks for the explanation. In our case, GOS attachments are stored via document class SOFFPHIO (redirected to SOFFHTTP). However, SOFFPHIO cannot be indexed in SKPR07 and shows errors in SDOKPHTAB. Is it correct that GOS/SAPoffice documents are not TREX‑indexable, and that only DMS document classes (e.g. DMS_PCD1) support TREX full‑text search?

entry.content:

Vaibhav Mishra

entry.title: Re: Remote Client copy
entry.content: These tables mainly store SAPoffice/attachment data (SOFF*). Performance and size issues are common—consider archiving (RSBCS_REORG / relevant SAP Notes) or moving attachments to an external Content Server (KPRO) to reduce load and improve copy/migration performance.

entry.title: Re: Download E-Mail + Attachment from CRM System to Local Harddrive
entry.content: We have a similar requirement to export CRM emails with attachments (including order reference) before system shutdown. If anyone has implemented a mass download solution or used a standard FM/class/report, please share your approach.

entry.title: Re: SAP Attachment Error: Due to document's naming conven...
entry.content:
Yes, linking SOFFPHIO to SOFFHTTP is mandatory when you want SAPoffice attachments to be stored on an external content server. The controlling configuration is done via KPRO Customizing (SKPR08 / SKPR07) and the tables SDOKPHCL (standard) and SDOKPHCL_C (customer override).

SDOKPHCL_C takes precedence over SDOKPHCL. If SOFFPHIO is not consistently mapped to SOFFHTTP in SDOKPHCL_C, attachments may still be processed via SOFFDB, causing errors—especially with filenames containing special characters (', ", etc.).

Special character issues are not caused by SOFFCONT1 directly, but by HTTP content server / KPRO encoding restrictions. Ensure:

  • Consistent mapping of SOFFPHIO → SOFFHTTP

  • Proper MIME type configuration

  • Latest SAP kernel and Content Server patches

As a workaround, avoid unsupported special characters or apply filename sanitization via BAdI/enhancement.

entry.title: Re: Date Issue within a Work Order Earliest & Latest finish dates
entry.content: It is happening with other orders also or only this one?

entry.title: Re: Saved attachments
entry.content: Thanks for the clarification. So attachment storage depends on SKPR08 settings (DB vs Content Server), and if stored in DB (SOFFCONT1) there’s no OS-level housekeeping—only careful SAPOffice reorganization programs apply.

entry.title: Re: Table splitting of REPOSRC for system copy
entry.content:
For R3ta table splitting, the split file format REPOSRC%10 is correct. The issue is the path. SAPINST expects the split file to be located inside the export directory (e.g. /usr/local/sap/Export/).
Run “Table Splitting Preparation” first – it should generate .WHR files under Export/ABAP/DATA. Once the .WHR files are created, proceed with the export.
If no .WHR files are generated, the split file path is still incorrect.

entry.title: Re: Long running homogenous Export -- stuck in Export ABAP phase
entry.content: This behavior is usually seen when very large tables (like SOFFCONT1 / SAPAPPL*) are still being exported. As long as the dump files are growing and R3load is running, the export is not stuck—it is still working. However, the repeated ORA‑01034 / DB connect errors indicate an unstable Oracle connection. Recommended actions: • Update R3load / R3trans to the latest patch • Run R3load -testconnect • Check Oracle alert log, processes, and memory limits • Ensure no DB restarts or listener interruptions For very large systems (800GB), long runtimes in the last ABAP export job are expected.

entry.title: Re: HANA Parameters to restrict Memory Usage
entry.content:
Memory shortages in SAP HANA cannot be solved only by setting statement_memory_limit parameters. These parameters only protect against single SQL statements and are not meant to control overall memory growth.

If tables like SEOCOMPODF, DD03L, DOKTL consume 40–50% memory even without active users, this usually points to:

  • Large dictionary / repository tables after upgrades or transports

  • Missing compression (column store tables not optimized)

  • Delta merge not performed

  • Row store fragmentation

Recommended actions:

  1. Follow SAP Note 1999997 completely (compression, cleanup, hybrid LOBs).

  2. Run table reorganization for row store tables (SAP Note 1813245).

  3. Trigger delta merge and compression for large column store tables.

  4. Check if the system is an ABAP system on HANA and ensure RS_B4HCON_CHECK_ENABLE recommendations are applied.

  5. Increasing memory should be the last option, only after cleanup and optimization.

Restarting HANA regularly is not a solution and indicates missing housekeeping or suboptimal configuration.

entry.title: Re: Heteregeneous copy with distribution monitor
entry.content: Great and very detailed documentation on heterogeneous system copy with DISTMON. Thanks for sharing practical tips on table splitting, Oracle PL/SQL splitter, and performance optimization—very helpful for large ECC migrations.

entry.title: Re: migration unicode Linux to unicode AIX
entry.content:
If the source system is already Unicode, you do not need to run a Unicode migration (SPUMG, UMG reset, etc.), even when moving from Linux (little endian) to AIX (big endian).

For a heterogeneous system copy (Unicode → Unicode):

  • Use standard system copy / heterogeneous migration via sapinst

  • Select Big Endian in sapinst for AIX

  • Use the correct target code page (4102) consistently

  • Ensure latest migration tools are used on the source system
    (R3load, R3ldctl, R3szchk, lib_dbsl)

The error
“(CNV) ERROR: There shall be only one Unicode in a database”
usually indicates a tool/codepage mismatch, not that another Unicode conversion is required.

No additional Unicode preparation steps are needed unless the source system is non‑Unicode.

entry.title: Re: Aggregated and Non Aggregated List in Story Reports
entry.content:
Hi!

A Cross-Tab story report in SAP SuccessFactors People Analytics is designed to aggregate or group identical values in consecutive rows. When creating this type of report, if there are identical values in a specific column, the first occurrence will be displayed, while subsequent occurrences will appear blank. 

Cross-tab: displays the data that is grouped or totaled in two directions. This is the default table.

A non-aggregated list table shows non-aggregated data in a list view in SAP Analytics Cloud stories.

This table type can be used for simple list-based reporting. A non-aggregated list table has all dimensions and measures on a single axis. This table does not necessarily need to have a measure. Because this table type shows raw data in a list, it is very likely for a dimension member to have multiple entries.

The following are features of non-aggregated list tables:

  • As opposed to the cross-tab table type, a non-aggregated list table is one-dimensional.

  • Dimensions and measures can be assigned to the column axis.

  • Dimensions and measures can appear in any order and can be reordered.

  • Rows display the members of a dimension, or the values of measures assigned to the column axis of the table as data.

  • Dimensions and measures are managed as similarly as possible, but different behaviors apply due to the different nature of the data.

    Options offered for dimensionsOptions offered for measures

    • Filter on members

    • Sort alphabetically

    • Sort by value

     

  • Styling in non-aggregated list tables applies to the coordinates of the table. It does not apply to the context.

entry.title: No error notifications received when email publication in SAC was sent to nonexisting email address
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

When I use the SAC Publication function to send an email to an external non-SAC user with an invalid email address, SAC does not appear to throw an error. However, this means we, as the senders, have no way of knowing that the email was not actually delivered to the recipient.

 

Since colleagues in our company may leave from time to time, their former corporate email addresses will be deactivated. If we fail to promptly update their personal email addresses in SAC, these ex-colleagues will not receive the emails—and we, as the senders, will remain unaware of this issue.
 
Could you please advise if there is any effective solution to this problem?
 
My tests in the SAC system show that even when an invalid email address is used, the publication job will still be marked as successful without any error prompts.
 
I also have a similar question: if the recipient is an existing SAC user but their email address has been changed (rendering the old one invalid), will we still not receive a delivery failure notification when sending publication emails to their old, non-existent email address?
 
Thank you in advance!
 
SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Re: Intent-based Navigation - semanticObjectAction annota...
entry.content:
Hi,

You can add with this way, Be careful, it must be same additionalBinding(element) name.

 

 

@Consumption.semanticObject : 'AccountingDocument'
@Consumption.semanticObjectMapping.additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'CompanyCode',element: 'CompanyCode' },
{ localElement: 'FiscalYear', element: 'FiscalYear' },
{ localElement: 'AccountingDocument', element: 'AccountingDocument' } ]
@ui: {
lineItem: [ { position: 110 ,importance: #HIGH ,
type: #WITH_INTENT_BASED_NAVIGATION,semanticObjectAction: 'displayDocument'}
],
identification:[ { position: 110 } ] }

AccountingDocument;

 

Best wishes

Erol ÇAĞLAR

entry.title: Accrual: Reset Procedure and Difference Procedure
entry.content:
Purpose

This blog mainly introduces how accrual (app ID: TPM44) works and what are the differences between reset procedure and difference procedure in Treasury and Risk Management (TRM), using illustrative examples based on the predefined configuration within S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Due to space constraints, this blog covers only the accrual and omits any discussion of deferral. You can always check help document Accrual/Deferral of Expenses and Revenues for more details regarding accrual and deferral.

Reset Procedure

First, let’s have a look at the following screen-shot taken from the configuration activity 102925 “Assign Update Types for Accrual/Deferral”.

Explanation for this configuration:

  • Profit-related flow MM1200+ is the update type for the nominal interest for an investment transaction of money market instrument. Its posting specification debits bank clearing (if payment request is not used) and credits interest income.
  • Reset Procedure is applied to the accrual of interest income on the source flow MM1200+.
  • The accrual of interest income is achieved via update type AD1000, and resetting accrual is done via AD1001.

The example below illustrates the reset procedure-based accrual of interest income for an investment transaction of interest rate instrument. This transaction starts on 01.10.2025, matures on 01.04.2026, interest rate is 3% (act/360), interest frequency is 2 months, start date of the interest period is included in the interest calculation. This transaction’s transaction/payment currency is USD, so its position currency is USD, whereas the valuation currency is EUR (=local currency of company code).

Check cash flow as below. The principal increase flow (flow type 1100, on 01.10.2025) has been fixed and posted. The next interest payment is on 01.12.2025.

At the October 2025 month-end close, the portion of interest income attributable to October should be accrued under accrual accounting.

Open the app Run Accrual/Deferral (app ID TPM44), and enter following data on its initial screen, the key date is 31.10.2025.

Execute TPM44, and check the log. System picks up the MM1200+ interest flow with calculation from 01.10.2025 to 01.12.2025, totally 61 days in this interest period, its amount in position currency is 5,083.33 USD. There are 31 days from 01.10.2025 to 31.10.2025 (because key date is included), therefore, the accrual amount in position currency =31/61*5,083.33=2,583.33 USD. The accrual amount in valuation currency=2,583.33*0.8512=2,198.93 EUR; 0.8512 is the exchange rate as of 31.10.2025. The accrual is recognized via AD1000, and it is reset via AD1001.

Check the posting log:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 31.10.2025 and the interest income recognized via accrual in October, after the accrual has been posted:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 01.11.2025 and the cumulative interest income recognized through that date, after the accrual has been reset:

At the next month-end close of November, execute TPM44 for key date 30.11.2025. Check the log. System still picks up the MM1200+ interest flow with calculation from 01.10.2025 to 01.12.2025, totally 61 days in this interest period, its amount in position currency is 5,083.33 USD. There are 61 days from 01.10.2025 to 30.11.2025 (because key date is included), therefore, the accrual amount in position currency =61/61*5,083.33=5,083.33 USD. The accrual amount in valuation currency = 5,083.33*0.8548=4,345.23 EUR; 0.8548 is the exchange rate as of 30.11.2025. The accrual is recognized via AD1000, and it is reset via AD1001.

Check the posting log:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 30.11.2025, and the interest income recognized via accrual in November (5,083.33-2,583.33=2,500.00 USD in position currency; 4,345.23-2,198.93=2,146.30 EUR in valuation currency), and the cumulative interest income recognized through 30.11.2025 (5,083.33 USD in position currency; 4,345.23 EUR in valuation currency), after the accrual has been posted:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 01.12.2025 and the cumulative interest income recognized through that date, after the accrual has been reset:

Access app Fix, Pay and Post Flows (app ID TBB1) to fix and post the MM1200+ interest flow on 01.12.2025. Check the posting log, MM1200+ debits bank clearing and credits interest income, the amount in position currency is 5,083.33 USD, the amount in valuation currency = 5,083.33*0.8475=4,308.12 EUR; 0.8475 is the exchange rate as of 01.12.2025.

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 01.12.2025 and the cumulative interest income recognized through that date, after the MM1200+ has been posted:

The cumulative interest income is fully recognized by MM1200+, because accruals are all reset.

At the next month-end close of December, execute TPM44 for key date 31.12.2025. Check the log:

System involves the MM1200+ interest flow with calculation from 01.12.2025 to 01.02.2026 into the accrual calculation for December. The logic is the same as described above and will not be repeated here.

It is worth noting that the fixed MM1200+ flow on 01.12. 2025 is excluded from the accrual calculation at 31.12.2025, because its interest income has been recognized via the posting of MM1200+ directly. This is one of the differences between the reset procedure and the difference procedure. The latter includes the fixed interest flow in the accrual calculation, and more details are provided in the next section.

Let’s now move on to the next section, "Difference Procedure".

Difference Procedure

First, let’s change the configuration as below in the configuration activity 102925 “Assign Update Types for Accrual/Deferral”.

Explanation for this configuration:

  • Profit-related flow MM1200+ is the update type for the nominal interest for an investment transaction of money market instrument. Its posting specification debits bank clearing (if payment request is not used) and credits accrual account, this is different from MM1200+’s posting spec under reset procedure.
  • Difference Procedure is applied to the accrual of interest income on the source flow MM1200+.
  • The accrual of interest income is achieved via update type AD1004; FX corrections are posted via AD1020 (positive) or AD1021 (negative).

The structure of the transaction used for illustrating difference procedure is the same as the transaction used for the reset procedure above.

Check cash flow. The principal increase flow (flow type 1100, on 01.10.2025) has been fixed and posted. The next interest payment is on 01.12.2025.

 At the October 2025 month-end close, the portion of interest income attributable to October should be accrued under accrual accounting.

Execute TPM44 for key date 31.10.2025, and check the log. System picks up the MM1200+ interest flow with calculation from 01.10.2025 to 01.12.2025, totally 61 days in this interest period, its amount in position currency is 5,083.33 USD. There are 31 days from 01.10.2025 to 31.10.2025 (because key date is included), therefore, the accrual amount in position currency =31/61*5,083.33=2,583.33 USD. The accrual amount in valuation currency = 2,583.33*0.8512=2198.93 EUR; 0.8512 is the latest exchange rate for 31.10.2025. The accrual is recognized via AD1004, and there is no reset of accrual.

Check the posting log:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 31.10.2025 and the interest income recognized via accrual in October, after the accrual has been posted:

At the next month-end close of November, execute TPM44 for key date 30.11.2025. Check the log:

System does the following calculations:

  • System picks up the MM1200+ interest flow with calculation from 01.10.2025 to 01.12.2025, totally 61 days in this interest period, its amount in position currency is 5,083.33 USD. There are 61 days from 01.10.2025 to 30.11.2025 (because key date is included), therefore, the cumulative accrual amount in position currency =61/61*5,083.33=5,083.33 USD, and the cumulative accrual amount in valuation currency =5,083.33*0.8548=4,345.23 EUR, 0.8548 is the exchange rate as of 30.11.2025.
  • Because the accrued income in October is 2,583.33 USD in position currency, the incremental accrual amount in position currency in November=5,083.33-2,583.33=2,500.00 USD; 2,500.00*0.8548=2,137.00 EUR. Therefore, the amounts of AD1004 as of 30.11.2025 are 2,500.00 USD in position currency and 2,137.00 EUR in valuation currency.
  • Because the accrued income in October is 2,198.93 EUR in valuation currency, the incremental accrual amount in valuation currency in November=4,345.23-2,198.93=2,146.30 EUR.
  • AD1004 as of 30.11.2025 carries 2,137.00 EUR in valuation currency, the difference, 2,146.30-2,137.00=9.30 EUR, is treated as the FX correction (positive) which is to be recognized via AD1020. AD1020 only posts in valuation currency (the amount in position currency is 0).

Check the posting log:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 30.11.2025, and the interest income recognized via accruals in October and November and their cumulative effect:

(Here AD1020 credits interest income, you may choose to credit it on FX gain account via modifying the account determination configuration based on your requirement)

Open app Treasury Position Clows - Classic (app ID TPM13), in which you can select position flow AD1004 as of 30.11.2025, click the button “Orig.Bus.Trans”, system will show you the detailed figures about accrual (which have been explained above).

Access app Fix, Pay and Post Flows (app ID TBB1) to fix and post the MM1200+ interest flow on 01.12.2025. Check the posting log, MM1200+ debits bank clearing and credits accrual account (this is different from the posting spec of MM1200+ under reset method, for you which may also need to change MM1200+’s account determination configuration), the amount in position currency is 5,083.33 USD, the amount in valuation currency = 5,083.33*0.8475=4,308.12 EUR; 0.8475 is the exchange rate as of 01.12.2025.

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 01.12.2025 and the cumulative interest income recognized through that date, after the MM1200+ has been posted. Accrual account has the balance 37.11 EUR in valuation currency, which looks “abnormal”, the TPM44 run at the end of December will “correct” it.

At the next month-end close of December, execute TPM44 for key date 31.12.2025. Check the log:

System does the following calculations:

  • System picks up two MM1200+ interest flows:
    • One MM1200+ has been fixed on 01.12.2025, its amounts 5,083.33 USD (in position currency) and 4,308.12 EUR (in valuation currency) are directly taken from the fixed position flow, they are also the amounts already recognized in accrual account via the posting of MM1200+ done by TBB1.
    • Another MM1200+ is still unfixed/planned. Its calculation from data is 01.12.2025 and calculation to date is 01.02.2026, totally 62 days in this interest period, its amount in position currency is 5,166.67 USD. There are 31 days from 01.12.2025 to 31.12.2025 (because key date is included), therefore, the accrual amount in position currency arising from this interest flow =31/62*5,166.67=2,583.33 USD, and the accrual amount in valuation currency =2,583.33*0.8498=2,195.31 EUR, 0.8548 is the exchange rate as of 30.11.2025.
  • The aggregate accrual in position currency from these two interest flows=5,083.33+2,583.33=7,666.66 USD.
  • The aggregate accrual in valuation currency from these two interest flows=4,308.12+2,195.31=6,503.43 EUR.
  • The aggregate accrual occurred in position currency in October and November (recorded in these two months’ AD1004)=2,583.33+2,500.00=5,083.33 USD.
  • The aggregate accrual occurred in valuation currency in October and November (recorded in these two months’ AD1004 and AD1020)=2,198.93+2,137.00+9.30=4,345.23 EUR.
  • The incremental accrual amount in position currency in December=7,666.66-5,083.33 =2,583.33 USD; 2,583.33*0.8498=2,195.31 EUR. Therefore, the amounts of AD1004 as of 31.12.2025 are 2,583.33 USD in position currency and 2,195.31 EUR in valuation currency.
  • The incremental accrual amount in valuation currency in December=6,503.43-4,345.23 =2,158.20 EUR.
  • AD1004 as of 31.12.2025 carries 2,195.31 EUR in valuation currency, the difference, 2,158.20-2,195.31=-37.11 EUR, is treated as the FX correction (negative) which is to be recognized via AD1021. AD1021 only posts in valuation currency (the amount in position currency is 0).

Check the posting log:

Use T-accounts to illustrate the balance of the accrual account as of 30.11.2025, and the interest income recognized via accruals in 3 months and their cumulative effect.

You may notice that, after TPM44 run on 31.12.2025, the accrual account only reflects the amounts related to the unfixed MM1200+ flow (2,583.33 USD / 2,195.31 EUR). This does not mean the fixed MM1200+ flow has been ignored or excluded from accrual calculation; it simply means the fixed flow’s accrual base is exactly equal to the amount already posted for MM1200+ flow via TBB1 on 01.12.2025. Because the two figures are identical, they offset each other in the accrual account, leaving only the incremental piece of the unfixed interest flow on the books.

You can also see that the cumulative interest income is 7,666.66 USD and 6,503.43 EUR, although they are all recognized through execution of TPM44 (no recognition of interest income is from MM1200+ interest flow), they can be explained in the following way:

  • 7,666.66 USD = 5,083.33 USD from the fixed interest flow + accrual amount 2,583.33 USD from the unfixed interest flow.
  • 6,503.43 EUR = 4,308.12 EUR from the fixed interest flow (applied with the exchange rate as of posting date of this interest flow) + accrual amount 2,195.31 EUR from the unfixed interest flow (applied with exchange rate as of the key date of TPM44 run).

In a word, the difference procedure treats TPM44 as the sole engine for recognition of interest income from the nominal interest flows: it incrementally processes every relevant interest flow—fixed and unfixed—and books the delta directly to the accrual account. When the flow is fixed and posted via TBB1 (or TPM10), its credit to the accrual account perfectly offsets the accrual recognized through TPM44, leaving the accrual account with a balance that reflects only the proportional accrual from as-yet-unfixed interest flows after TPM44 run.

Open app Treasury Position Clows - Classic (app ID TPM13), in which you can select position flow AD1004 as of 31.12.2025, click the button “Orig.Bus.Trans”, system will show you the detailed figures about accrual (which have been explained above).

Additional note on the difference procedure: if no update type is assigned to “FX Corr. Positive” or “FX Corr. Negative” in the configuration as shown below, TPM44 still performs the FX correction and defaults to AD1004 for “FX Corr. Positive” and AD1001 for “FX Corr. Negative”.

Additional Notes

  • Exchange rates used in the examples:

  • App Reverse Accrual/Deferral (app ID: TPM45) is used to reverse accrual or deferral done by TPM44.
  • For accrual should be considered during Legacy Data Transfer, please refer to another blog XXXXXXXXXXXXX (to be created soon!).
  • For the financial transactions adopting risk-free rates (e.g. SOFR, €STR), the variable interest flows should use the interest calculation types Compound Interest Calculation and Average Compound Interest Calculation, please configure the Grouping Term in configuration activity 102925 “Assign Update Types for Accrual/Deferral” for accrual/deferral of interest income or expenses for such kind of transactions. Please refer to blog Manage Risk-free Rate (RFR) Interest Rate Instrument with Accumulating Condition for a detailed example.

entry.title: Posting date/period 27.05.2025/005 is earlier than existing date
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

 

We went live on 08.12.2025. The customer requested to migrate budget and consumption for the previous 5 years for open projects, as this is a construction company with several ongoing projects.

During migration, the customer migrated all 2025 PRs using

FMCN → FMCT → FMN3N, with a system posting date of 23.12.2025.

At the same time, Period-Based Encumbrance Tracking (PBET) is active, and some of these PRs have Version Management records.

Now, when users try to change any of these PRs, the system raises the following error since it copied pasting date from the version to FMIOI_ZHLDT  :

 

Posting date/period 27.05.2025/005 is earlier than existing date/period 23.12.2025/012

Message No. FI_E050

 

Diagnosis

In PBET, commitment postings require that the posting date of a new transaction or change must be later than or equal to the posting date of the existing commitment line item.

Since the migrated documents were posted with a future system date (23.12.2025), any subsequent change using a real business date in 2025 is rejected

 

Current Options Considered

I am considering the following approaches:

 

Delete and reconstruct the migrated commitments using a posting date such as 01.01.2025.

 

Search for a function module or technical approach to update the posting date field (ZHLDT) for the migrated commitment items.

Kindly advise on the recommended and supported approach in this scenario.

Public Sector

entry.title: Re: Group Reporting Automatic postings based on Selection...
entry.content:
Hi Eyal,

If the rule must evaluate the sum of several FS items that are included in the source, I see 2 options.

1. In the source data definition, exclude the field FS items, then the amounts are aggregated on this field, and your formula should work. This option works if you do not need to keep the FS item value in the processing for instance to inherit the FS items in the posting lines.

2. Create a variable that selects the FS items you need to sum and evaluate, and use this variable in the posting line formula: IF(VARIABLE>0,SOURCE_LC,0).

More information on the variables: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-s-4hana-for-group-reporting-using-variables-and-functions-in-rules-for/ba-p/14266911 

See also this roadmap item about conditions in rules for automatic postings.  https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?BC=6EAE8B27FCC11ED892E919ED096400CC&range=CURRENT-LAST#;INNO=000D3ABE772D1FD0ABE122A09494DCFD 

Hope this helps.

Grégoire

entry.title: I can't change the Service Contract assigned to the WBS.
entry.content:
Hi Expert！

WBS elements are assigned to the Service Contract as follows:

<Image>
Service Contract:7000000001　Header WBS elements: A
Item 100   item Status：Release　Item WBS elements: A

After changing the Status of the Service Contract Item to "Complete", I change the status of WBS element: A  to "Complete"

<Image>
Service Contract:7000000001　Header WBS elements: A
Item 100   item Status：Complete　Item WBS elements: A  

Then, add Service Contract Item 200 and assign WBS elements: B. (The status of WBS elements: B is Released.)

<Image>
Service Contract:7000000001　Header WBS elements: B
Item 100   item Status：Complete　WBS elements: A
Item 200   item Status：Release　WBS elements: B

If I save at this time, an error message will appear saying "System status Technically completed is active for WBS Element:A."

Why am I getting an error related to WBS elements: A even though I haven't made any changes to Service Contract Item 100, to which WBS elements: A are assigned?

Soma

entry.title: Re: S4HANA BP Default Standard Communication Method field...
entry.content:
Hi, 

you can update the field status as optional or required with the help of configuration

SPRO → Cross-Application Components → SAP Business Partner → Business Partner → Basic Settings → Field Groupings
you can check the field group with the help of BDT_ANALYZER tcode (open it in BP transaction) in BP tcode  and 
CVI_CHECK_VISIBILITY (to identify the field group) and update that field group in Field Groupings for client, role, activity configs

entry.title: Re: TM Module- Apart from Freight order, process Freight...
entry.content:
Hi @Rajkumar1989 ,
You should handle these supplier‑specific freight charges by creating a separate condition type or surcharge in the PO that is linked to the relevant line items via account assignment and distribution rules in TM, rather than at header or unplanned delivery cost level. This allows you to accrue and distribute costs only to the partial quantities/items impacted, while keeping them distinct from carrier freight charges

You must consider that if two different payees, Freight Carrier vs. PO Supplier. TM already handles. if it's a carrier costs, supplier freight charges need a parallel but distinct mechanism. if granularity, charges apply only to some PO items/quantities, not the entire PO. Costs must be captured at GRN/accrual stage, not delayed until MIRO, to avoid stock valuation issues. Regarding scalability, with 100+ PO lines, manual distribution is impractical.

My recommendation path as mentioned below.
Define a custom PO condition type (e.g., ZFRS) for supplier freight.
Configure TM cost distribution to allocate this condition only to relevant PO items/quantities.
Automate identification rules (e.g., based on Incoterms, material group, or supplier freight agreements) so buyers don’t manually edit every PO line.
Post accruals at GRN so inventory valuation reflects supplier freight immediately.
Keep supplier freight separate from carrier freight in FI postings for clarity.

entry.title: Re: I can't change the Service Contract assigned to the WBS.
entry.content:
The root cause is in your Service Contract header, the Header WBS element is still A. Even though you added Item 200 and assigned WBS element B, the contract header continues to reference WBS A. When you set WBS A to “Technically Complete (TECO)”, the system prevents any further changes or postings against that WBS element. Saving the contract triggers a consistency check: SAP validates the header assignment first. Since the header is still tied to WBS A (now TECO), the system raises the error.

Why the error appears is because, item 100 is complete, but it still carries WBS A. Header also carries WBS A. When you add Item 200 with WBS B, the system checks the overall contract structure. Because the header is still linked to WBS A (TECO), SAP interprets the contract as trying to use a technically completed WBS element. That’s why the error message refers to WBS A, even though you didn’t touch Item 100.

You have two options to resolve this

Update the Service Contract header to reference WBS B (or a higher-level WBS that is still active). This way, the contract is no longer tied to WBS A, and the error disappears.

If the header must remain on WBS A for reporting reasons, then you cannot add new active items under the same contract once WBS A is TECO. In this case, you’d need to create a new Service Contract for items linked to WBS B.

entry.title: Re: OData V4 API Pagination in SAP Cloud Integration
entry.content:
that is not client side pagination....

 

this is also nonsense.....

Why Client-Side Pagination?
While server-side pagination works well for smaller datasets, it can become inefficient when the total number of records is large and fetching data page by page may consume more time and delaying overall integration performance.

entry.title: Re: FM or Report to retrieve GOS attachments
entry.content:
For retrieving GOS attachments, first identify the attachment type.

  • For Standard PC documents (GOS), use table SRGBTBREL to get the business object link.

  • The physical document is stored via KPro and can be traced using
    SOFFPHIO → SOFFLOIO → SOFFPHF → SOFFCONT1 (for SOFFDB) or via content server (SOFFHTTP).

To retrieve the file content programmatically:

  • Use CL_BINARY_RELATION=>READ_LINKS_OF_OBJECTS to get document IDs

  • Then use SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 or SCMS_DOC_READ_FILES to read the binary

  • Convert using SCMS_BINARY_TO_XSTRING

For ArchiveLink-based attachments, refer to TOA01/TOA02 and repositories in OAC0.

This approach works even if the business object link is broken, as long as the PHIO exists.

entry.title: Re: Attachment issue in Delivery
entry.content:
If the PDF is written to TOAAT but does not appear in the Delivery attachment list, the issue is almost always missing or incorrect GOS linkage, not the file upload itself.

For a Delivery (object LIKP / BOR object BUS2032), all of the following must be consistent:

1️⃣ Check GOS relationship (most common root cause)

GOS reads attachments via SRGBTBREL.

Verify:

  • RELTYPE = ATTA

  • INSTID_A = Delivery number (with leading zeros)

  • TYPEID_A = BUS2032

  • CATID_A = BO

  • INSTID_B = Archive document ID

If no SRGBTBREL entry exists, the attachment will never appear, even if TOAAT contains data.

2️⃣ Validate ArchiveLink tables

Depending on upload method, ensure consistency in:

  • TOA01 / TOA02 – business object ↔ document linkage

  • TOAAT – archive document metadata

  • OAC0 / OACT – repository configuration

A mismatch in object type or key format breaks display.

3️⃣ Use SAP APIs instead of direct table inserts

Direct writes to TOAAT are not sufficient.

Recommended APIs:

  • ARCHIV_CREATE_TABLE

  • ARCHIV_CONNECTION_INSERT

  • CL_BINARY_RELATION=>CREATE_LINK

  • Or standard GOS services (SGOS, BDS_GOS_CONNECTIONS_GET)

These ensure TOA, SRGBTBREL, and KPro consistency*.

4️⃣ Quick troubleshooting checklist

  • Check attachment visibility via SGOS

  • Verify Delivery key formatting (VBELN with ALPHA)

  • Confirm user has ArchiveLink authorization

  • Test same file via manual GOS upload (to isolate config vs code)

entry.title: Re: How to get list of all the documents attached to all...
entry.content:
To get a list (and count) of all documents attached to all equipment in a specific plant, use GOS linkage tables.

High‑level approach:

  1. Get Equipment list for the plant

    • Table: EQUI

    • Filter by WERKS = <Plant>

  2. Get GOS attachment links

    • Table: SRGBTBREL

    • TYPEID_A = 'EQUI'

    • INSTID_A = EQUI-EQUNR

  3. Resolve document storage

    • For SAP Office / PC documents:

      • SOFFPHIO → storage category (SOFFDB / SOFFHTTP)

      • SOFFCONT1 (if stored in DB)

    • For ArchiveLink documents:

      • TOA01 / TOA02 (depending on object)

      • Content repository via OAC0

  4. Count documents

    • Count entries in SRGBTBREL per equipment

    • Aggregate by plant

Result:
You can build a report showing:

  • Equipment number

  • Number of attachments

  • Storage type (DB vs Content Server)

Tip:
If you only need counts (not file content), SRGBTBREL + EQUI is sufficient and performs well.

entry.title: Re: Lista de Anexos - MIGO
entry.content: In addition to SRGBTBREL (RELTYPE = ATTA, OBJTYPE = BUS2017), you can use SGOS for spot checks or OAAD if ArchiveLink is involved. This helps distinguish GOS vs ArchiveLink attachments.

entry.title: Re: Invoice Attachment in MM Document
entry.content: In Scan/VIM/VIP scenarios, attachments are usually stored via ArchiveLink, not only GOS. For MIRO (BUS2081), SRGBTBREL may be incomplete. Please also check TOA01 / TOA02 (ArchiveLink connections) using the MM document number, and verify the content repository in OAC0. For VIM/OpenText, invoice images are often linked at FI level (BKPF/BUS2081) or via VIM tables, so SRGBTBREL alone won’t give accurate results.

entry.title: Re: How to check attachments to a document
entry.content: ✔️ Confirming this works: for GOS attachments on parked documents, check SRGBTBREL with RELTYPE = ‘ATTA’ and INSTID_A = document key. If needed programmatically, BDS_GOS_CONNECTIONS_GET can also be used to list attachments.

entry.content:
@Dominik_Tylczynski  Thanks for your comment. MM is for purchasing and inventory management. It is just that the story has a second part, as the MM cycle starts with the purchasing, I get more in-depth with the procurement process, and I didn't want the article to get more detailed, so I summarized the end of the procure-to-pay cycle in this article without elaborating on the inventory management part. I would like to thank you for highlighting this in your comment.

Glad to connect on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/omarossama/

entry.title: Re: service for Objects table TOA01 contains partial atta...
entry.content:
This is expected behavior. GOS “standard PC documents” are stored via SRGBTBREL, while ArchiveLink / billing printouts are stored via TOA01. Different attachment services → different linkage tables.

For dates in SRGBTBREL, the UTCTIME field is already in YYYYMMDDhhmmss format (no translation table needed).

entry.title: Re: Purchase order Attachments
entry.content: In addition to SRGBTBREL (BUS2012), for content retrieval you can follow the KPro chain (SOFFPHIO → SOFFPHF → SOFFCONT1) or use SCMS_* FMs for SAPoffice documents. For migration scenarios, a custom extraction program is required as standard mass download is not available.

entry.title: Re: Create GOS attachment from xstring document
entry.content: ✔️ Root cause is missing OBJECT_HEADER metadata, not the XSTRING itself. For non‑PDF files (DOCX/XLSX/JPG), &SO_FILENAME, &SO_FORMAT=BIN and correct DOC_SIZE (XSTRLEN) are mandatory in SO_DOCUMENT_INSERT_API1. Once OBJECT_HEADER is filled correctly, attachments open without corruption — even when XSTRING comes from Fiori/OData.

entry.title: Re: Attachment list
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA, there is no standard report or tcode that shows attachments for multiple FI documents at once.

GOS attachments are stored via Generic Object Services, so the correct technical approach is to use table SRGBTBREL.

How to check attachments for multiple FI documents:

  1. Identify the Business Object for FI documents

    • For FI accounting documents → TYPEID_A = BKPF (or BUS2012 depending on scenario)

  2. Query table SRGBTBREL

    • TYPEID_A = Business Object (e.g. BKPF)

    • INSTID_A = concatenated key
      BELNR + BUKRS + GJAHR

    • RELTYPE = ATTA

  3. If records exist, the document has attachments

    • Multiple rows = multiple attachments

  4. For mass analysis:

    • Use SE16N

    • Or create a custom report

    • Optionally enrich with timestamp (UTCTIME) to see when attachments were added

Note:
This works for FB03 / FBL3N / FBL1N / FBL5N posted documents and is valid for both ECC and S/4HANA.

entry.title: Enhancement Request: Population of MLCATEG and MLPTYPE in ACDOCA during CKMLCP Post Closing
entry.content:
Summary: I would like to propose an enhancement regarding the population of Material Ledger category fields (MLCATEG and MLPTYPE) within the Universal Journal (ACDOCA) generated during the Actual Costing closing run (CKMLCP).

Current Behavior: Currently, when a logistics movement occurs (e.g., Production Consumption - mvt 261), the system correctly populates ACDOCA-MLCATEG (e.g., with ‘VN’) and ACDOCA-MLPTYPE. This allows for precise identification of the process type directly from the finance table.

However, during the “Post Closing” step of the Material Ledger Cockpit (CKMLCP), the generated revaluation documents (typically document type ML, Ref Proc MLHD) do not populate these fields in ACDOCA. While the detailed information regarding the origin of the variance (Consumption vs. Ending Inventory) exists in the Material Ledger tables (like MLDOC), this granularity is lost or not transferred to the MLCATEG field in the generated FI document.

Business Requirement & Pain Point: As we aim to utilize ACDOCA as the “Single Source of Truth” for financial and management reporting, we need to analyze the “Actual Consumption” split (Standard + Price Differences) by process category (e.g., separating Production Consumption from other consumptions).

Currently, because MLCATEG is empty for the revaluation lines, we cannot easily distinguish if a revaluation amount on a consumption account is related to Production (VN) or other processes without building complex logic or joining back to specific ML tables.

Proposal: We suggest that the system should transfer the corresponding category information to ACDOCA-MLCATEG and MLPTYPE during the CKMLCP posting logic. For instance, if the system is revaluating consumption based on a production order, the resulting line item in ACDOCA should carry MLCATEG = 'VN', similar to the original goods issue document.

Benefits:

  1. Consistency: Aligns the data structure of closing documents with daily logistics documents.
  2. Reporting Efficiency: Enables simpler and faster SQL/CDS reporting directly on ACDOCA without the need for complex joins or workarounds to identify the nature of the revaluation.
  3. Transparency: Provides immediate visibility into the nature of variances (Production vs. Sales vs. Scrap) in the Universal Journal.

Thank you for considering this improvement.

entry.title: Re: Dynamic table name in Select * From (Table_name)
entry.content: I don't understand that. Why should it be dynamic if it is only executed once?

entry.title: Re: Report for PR's with attachments
entry.content:
There is no standard SAP report to list Purchase Requisitions (PRs) with attachments.

If attachments are added via Generic Object Services (GOS), you can identify PRs with attachments using table SRGBTBREL:

  • RELTYPE = ATTA

  • TYPEID_A = BUS2105 (Purchase Requisition)

  • INSTID_A = PR number (with leading zeros)

This table stores the relationship between the PR and its attachments.
You can build a custom report (or SE16N query) based on SRGBTBREL and join with EBAN to display PR details.

If attachments were added via DMS, then tables like DRAW / DRAD may be relevant, but for GOS attachments SRGBTBREL is the correct and recommended approach.

entry.title: Re: attachment in maintenance orders
entry.content:
If the attachment is added via Services for Object (GOS) in a maintenance order, it is stored as a GOS relationship.

You can identify maintenance orders with attachments using table SRGBTBREL with:

  • RELTYPE = 'ATTA'

  • TYPEID_A = BUS2007 (PM Order)

  • INSTID_A = Order Number

The actual document metadata/content is linked via SOOD / SOFM / SOFF* tables.

There is no standard indicator or report in PM orders to show attachments.
If you need a visual indicator or reporting:

  • Create a custom report reading SRGBTBREL

  • Or set a user status at save using user-exit IWO10009 when attachments exist (commonly used approach)

entry.title: Re: SD Archiving - archive attachment of SD documents
entry.content:
Hi Kalyan,

Good questions 👍
Short answer: the procedure described in the blog applies only to SAPoffice / GOS attachments, not to all attachment types.

Here is the breakdown:

1. GOS / SAPoffice attachments (SOOD / SOFM / SOC3)
✔ Yes, these are covered by SD_VBAK with “Archive Attachments” flag
✔ Post‑processing with RSBCS_REORG is required to clean up SOOD / SOC3
✔ This is exactly what the blog explains

2. ArchiveLink attachments (OAC, TOA0x tables)*
❌Not handled by SD_VBAK
✔ These are archived via ArchiveLink customizing + Content Server
✔ Deletion is controlled by:

  • ArchiveLink retention rules

  • Archiving object of the business document (e.g. SD_VBAK)

  • Content repository settings (OAC0 / OAC3)

You must ensure the link entries (TOA01, TOA02, …) are deleted by the application archiving object and the physical document is removed by the content server.

3. KPRO / DMS attachments (tables like DMS, KPRO, links via SRGBTBREL)*
❌Not archived by SD_VBAK
✔ These follow DMS archiving objects (e.g. DMS_DOC)
✔ Relationship entries in SRGBTBREL may remain if the document itself is still retained

4. BRF+ / Output attachments (SFORM_A_STORAGE)
❌Not part of SD_VBAK
✔ Archived via Output Management / BRF+ specific cleanup reports
✔ Retention depends on output framework configuration and application logs

5. Guide for SD_VBAK
Best references are:

  • SAP Note 2940339 – Archiving of attachments in SD

  • Transaction AOBJ / ACLA (check class SGOS, SBCS)

  • SAP Help Portal for Data Archiving in S/4HANA SD

Summary:
SD_VBAK only archives GOS/SAPoffice attachments.
Other attachment types (ArchiveLink, DMS/KPRO, BRF+) must be handled by their own archiving concepts.

Hope this clarifies the scope.

Regards,
Juveria

entry.title: Re: Need to find table for dispute case attachments in se...
entry.content:
GOS attachments are stored via the Generic Object Services framework.
The link between the business object and the attachment is maintained in SRGBTBREL.
Actual document content is stored in SOOD / SOFM / SOFFCONT1 (or on a content server).
You can retrieve attachments programmatically using BDS_GOS_CONNECTIONS_GET or CL_GOS_MANAGER.
There is no standard report; a custom report is required.

entry.title: Re: OK (aRs?)- next question is on URL's from BAPI_REL_GE...
entry.content:
For GOS URL attachments, the actual HTTP URL is not stored directly in SRGBTBREL.
You need to read the linked SAPoffice document.

Use FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 and pass DOCUMENT_ID = SRGBTBREL-INSTID_B.
The URL is stored in the returned OBJECT_CONTENT (usually as plain text containing the full HTTP/HTTPS link).

This is the standard way to retrieve URLs created via Services for Object (GOS).

entry.title: Re: where the attached files stores in SAP table
entry.content:
In SAP 4.6C, GOS framework is not fully available, so table SRGBTBREL does not exist.
Attachments in FB03 are stored via SAPoffice:

  • SOOD / SOFM / SOC3 → document metadata and content

  • Link to FI document is handled internally via SAPoffice objects (not via SRGBTBREL)

From ECC 5.0 / 6.0 onward, GOS is used and links are stored in SRGBTBREL (with TYPEID_A = BKPF/BSEG).

So for 4.6C, check SOOD/SOFM, not SRGBTBREL.

entry.title: Re: Read data from attachment List
entry.content:
Nice and clear explanation 👍
Using SRGBTBREL together with SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 is very helpful for reading notes from the GOS attachment list, especially for FI documents and Fiori scenarios. Thanks for sharing the step-by-step approach and sample code.

entry.title: Re: How to copy GOS attachments from main document(FB03)...
entry.content:
This is not a GOS (SRGBTBREL) case but an ArchiveLink scenario.

If attachments exist only in TOA01, they are ArchiveLink documents. To copy attachments from the original FI document (FB03) to the reversal document (FB08), you must use ArchiveLink APIs, not GOS logic.

Approach:

  1. Read existing ArchiveLink connections of the original document using TOA01 / ArchiveLink function modules.

  2. Create new ArchiveLink links for the reversal document with the same archive document IDs.

  3. Standard ArchiveLink FMs/classes (e.g. ARCHIV_GET_CONNECTIONS / ARCHIV_CONNECTION_INSERT) can be used.

Since there are no SRGBTBREL entries, GOS is not involved here.

entry.title: Re: Sending Attachments of RFQ in Mail
entry.content:
In standard SAP, GOS attachments added to RFQs (ME42 → Services for Object) are not included automatically in output emails (NEU, external send). This requires custom development.

You can fetch the attachment via table SRGBTBREL using the RFQ number in INSTID_A, read the document ID from INSTID_B, and then use FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 to retrieve the file and attach it manually to the email.

SAP Note 1296758 (PO attachments via mail) describes the same approach, which also applies to RFQs.

entry.title: Re: Check Invoice posted without attachment
entry.content:
There is no standard SAP report to list invoices posted without attachments.

For FI documents, GOS attachments are stored via SRGBTBREL:

  • TYPEID_A = 'BKPF' → header-level attachment

  • TYPEID_A = 'BSEG' → line-item attachment

  • INSTID_A = Company Code + Document Number + Fiscal Year

To find invoices without attachments, create a custom report:

  1. Select accounting documents from BKPF (based on company code, posting date, document type, etc.).

  2. Left outer join with SRGBTBREL on object type (BKPF/BSEG) and instance ID.

  3. Documents with no matching entry in SRGBTBREL are invoices posted without attachments.

Standard reports like FB03 / FBL1N cannot directly identify missing attachments.

entry.title: Re: If I attach a document to Work Permit (WCA), in which...
entry.content:
If the document is attached via GOS (Services for Object), the linkage is stored in SRGBTBREL (use RELTYPE = 'ATTA' and TYPEID_A = 'WCA').
If the attachment is via DMS, check DRAD with DOKOB = 'WCAAP'.
You can build a report by joining these tables to list WCA vs attached document names.

entry.title: Re: attachment filename in PM ORDER
entry.content:
For PM orders, GOS attachments are only linked in SRGBTBREL (relationship table).
The filename is not stored there.

To get the filename:

  • For GOS/SAPoffice attachments:
    Use SRGBTBREL-INSTID_B and read document details via SOOD / SOFM or FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 (field OBJ_DESCR / FILE_NAME).

  • For ArchiveLink attachments:
    Check TOA01 and then read metadata from the ArchiveLink repository (configured via OAM1).

So the filename depends on the attachment type (GOS vs ArchiveLink) and must be read from the corresponding storage tables, not from SRGBTBREL directly.

entry.title: Re: Botón Servicios para Objetos de los objetos SAP
entry.content:
Para los adjuntos GOS, la tabla SRGBTBREL solo guarda la relación con el objeto, no el contenido ni el tamaño.

El tamaño (bytes) del adjunto se obtiene en las tablas de SAPoffice:

  • SOFM → campo DOC_SIZE

  • Relación:

    • SRGBTBREL-INSTID_B = documento SAPoffice

    • SOFM-DOCYR = SOOD-OBJYR

    • SOFM-DOCNO = SOOD-OBJNO

Alternativamente, se puede obtener vía FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1, que devuelve metadatos y contenido del documento.

entry.title: Re: Attachment list to PM orders
entry.content:
There is no standard transaction to view GOS (Services for Objects) attachments for multiple PM orders at once.
To get this information, you need a custom report.

GOS attachments are stored via table SRGBTBREL (use TYPEID_A = BUS2007 for PM orders and INSTID_A = AUFNR).
To get attachment details like creator and filename, join SRGBTBREL with SOOD / SOFM (using INSTID_B → OBJTP/OBJYR/OBJNO).

Attachment content can be read using FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 or SO_OBJECT_GET_CONTENT.

entry.title: Re: Data Migration from SOFTCONT tables
entry.content:
You can identify and extract customer master attachments created via GOS using table SRGBTBREL.

  • Use TYPEID_A = KNA1 / KNB1

  • Use INSTID_A = Customer Number

This gives you all attachments linked to selected customers.
To read the actual documents, use standard content server FMs such as SCMS_DOC_INFO, SCMS_AO_FILE_GET, or SCMS_AO_TABLE_GET.
The same GOS framework can be used in the target system to re‑attach the documents.

entry.title: Re: Sending mail with workflow functionality
entry.content:
Hi,
Attachments stored via GOS are linked in SRGBTBREL and the document content is stored in SOOD / SOFM.
You can first read the document using SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 or SO_OBJECT_READ, and then send the email with attachment using SO_NEW_DOCUMENT_ATT_SEND_API1.
This is the standard approach to send emails with attachments stored in SAPoffice tables.

Regards.

entry.title: Re: Table to store Vendor master attachment
entry.content:
Vendor master attachments created via GOS (Services for Objects) are stored via object links in table SRGBTBREL.
Use TYPEID_A = LFA1 (or KRED depending on release) and INSTID_A = Vendor number to identify the attachments.
The actual document metadata/content can be found in SOOD / SOFM / SOC3 using INSTID_B from SRGBTBREL.

entry.title: Re: Attachment List FM or Report in QM notification
entry.content:
There is no standard FM or report in SAP to track deleted GOS attachments for QM notifications.
GOS attachments are indexed in SRGBTBREL, but once an attachment is deleted, the entry is physically removed and no deletion log is kept.

If audit history is required, the options are:
• Enable table audit logging (via Basis) for SRGBTBREL / SAPoffice tables
• Create a custom snapshot/compare program to track daily changes
• Implement a GOS BAdI / enhancement to log create/delete events

Standard SAP does not provide deletion indicators for GOS attachments.

entry.title: Re: RSBCS_REORG to delete records from Table SOFFCONT1
entry.content:
RSBCS_REORG does not directly delete SOFFCONT1 rows line‑by‑line in the report logic. The deletion is handled via BCS/KPro cleanup.
To effectively reduce SOFFCONT1, SAP recommends running the full cleanup sequence:

  1. RSSO_DELETE_PRIVATE (delete documents in user folders)

  2. RSSODFRE (clean up folders / hidden folders)

  3. RSBCS_REORG (BCS reorganization)

After this, SOFFCONT1 row count and data size decrease (unused space increases), which can be verified via DBACOCKPIT → Single Table Analysis.
See SAP Notes 1641830, 1634908, and 567975 for the complete procedure.

entry.title: Re: Service for Object
entry.content:
“Service for Objects (GOS) does not use a single table.
The main tables involved are:

  • SRGBTBREL – stores the relationship between business object and attachment

  • SOOD / SOFM – SAPoffice document metadata

  • SOC3 / SOFFCONT1 – attachment content storage

The business object can be identified using TYPEID_A and INSTID_A in SRGBTBREL.”
